Node.definition: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ from Teman (תֵּימָנִי) ► friend of Job (אִיֹּוב) who comes to comfort but concludes by arguing with Job
= descendant or inhabitant of Teman (תֵּימָן)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
literally: breath or wind; hence: = action by which humans speak words with no substance or value
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= action by which humans or deities express their disapproval of something with words
= causative process by which certain objects or activities promote someone's well being

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= state in which humans experience fear

Node.gloss: to remove|to take|to reduce|to diminish|to hold back|to withhold
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to be less or no longer involved in a certain activity
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= to impart knowledge to someone else
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

= state in which someone is be able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense

Node.gloss: to declare guilty|to condemn as guilty
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans guilty before God or humanity, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action by which humans provide evidence in court
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= process by which humans and animals bring forth new offspring
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= a group or gathering of persons (like friends or members of the same group) or heavenly beings
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to remove|to take|to reduce|to diminish|to hold back|to withhold
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to be less or no longer involved in a certain activity
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which humans are advanced in age; ≈ often associated with wisdom and respectability
literally: strong in days; hence: = state in which humans are advanced in age; ≈ associated with wisdom
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= pertaining to being of relatively limited importance
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= pertaining to being performed at a slow pace, without intensity

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: to cause (one's) spirit to turn (towards someone); hence: = action by which humans express their anger in words
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
literally: to bring out; hence: = action by which humans utter words
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= state in which someone is considered as upright and innocent in character and behavior

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
literally; holy one; hence: = supernatural being in the service of God

Node.gloss: to have faith|to keep faith|to trust|to believe
Node.definition: = state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or deity, which means that this person or deity does only speak the truth but is also faithful, and willing and able to help
literally heaven, but with focus on the creatures that live there: = supernatural beings
literally: to be clean; hence: = state in which people are considered to be without any moral contamination and therefore trustworthy

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

marker pointing to information that substantiates a particular assertion even more conclusively than previous information, which was presented in an immediately preceding utterance as an valid substantiation of that assertion
= state of being totally evil and corrupted in one's thinking and actions
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way
= causative action by which humans convey information to other humans
= process by which humans gain knowledge and wisdom; ◄ from what they have observed

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= causative action by which humans refrain from sharing information with others
= indirect male progenitor
= state of being integrated but physically detached from other, similar objects or events

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to tremble|to be distressed|to be in anguish
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience strong fear and distress, ◄ compared to the state of mind of a woman in labor; ► often accompanied by physical side effects, like writhing, and trembling
= the quantity of a number of objects or the frequency of a number of events
to store up events; hence: = to prepare for events to take place in the future
= state in which a person is a strong and powerful enemy, who is thinks high of himself and is prone to violence, and usually does not fear God
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or event, which means that this person is believed to be speaking the truth, or that this event is true
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
= action by which humans or deities watch attentitvely to monitor people and places
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= action by which humans and animals leave their home or move about from place to place without clear destination
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the question whether an object actually exists at all, rather than with a specific location in mind
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: to be established; hence: = state in which all the steps have been taken that are needed for an event to take place
literally: in (one's) hand; hence: = state in which an event is about to take place

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
= causative process by which a specific event causes someone else to be in deep distress
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= state in which humans experience distress
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state in which someone is prepared for an event
meaning unsure; possibly: = fight between armies
literally: to stretch out (one's) hand (against someone); hence: = action by which humans openly show resistance to someone else
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to stretch out (one's) hand (to punish)|to defy
Node.definition: literally: to stretch out (one's) arm; hence: = action by which deities prepare to punish to humans|literally: to stretch out (one's) hand (against someone); hence: = action by which humans openly show resistance to someone else
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

literally: to make oneself strong; hence: = action by which humans or deities present themselves with boldness to other humans and deities, ≈ which may be good or bad depending on whether this boldness is justified
= part of the body connecting the rump to the head; ► a ;place to wear ornaments, but also a yoke; ≈ a stiff neck is associated with insolence and pride
= state in which an object or substance is relatively thick
meaning unsure; possibly: = a human made object with a somewhat convex shape

= a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God
= state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible
= fat parts ◄ of the body of animals and human beings; ► often the main ingredient of a sacrifice; ≈ regarded as the best part of the meat, but also associated with unresponsiveness and stubbornness
literally: to make (possessions); hence: = action by which humans obtain possessions
= area of the body located on both sides of the spine between the ribs the the hip; location where fat can accumulate

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= causitive action or process by which humans or deities forcibly terminate the existence of an individual or group of people

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which objects gradually change into something else
= a pile of stones, ► sometimes used as a memorial for an important event
= objects that people possess in a relatively large quantity; ≈ greatly valued by the owner, strongly coveted by other people, and a cause of status
= state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
= young branch growing from the stump or stem of a tree or plant
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence are caused to lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
literally: (God's) breath; hence: = process by which humans are punished by God, ◄ described as a flaming breath coming from his mouth
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: to have faith|to keep faith|to trust|to believe
Node.definition: = state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or deity, which means that this person or deity does only speak the truth but is also faithful, and willing and able to help
= state in which objects or activities do not serve a valid purpose and can only lead to disappointment
= state in which objects or activities do not serve a valid purpose and can only lead to disappointment

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= process by which a certain amount of time fully elapses
= branch of a palm tree
= process by which a plant lets go of its fruits

= a creeping plant that develops a woody stem when it matures; it grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils (שָׂרִיג) ◄ vitis vinifera; ► it bears clusters (אֶשְׁכֹּל) of grapes (עֲנָב) that are sweet and juicy and can be made into wine (יַיִן) ≈ a symbol of blessing, prosperity, and happiness
collective: = the fruit of the vine (גֶּפֶן) after the stage of having flowers (נִצָּה) and before being mature for consumption; ≈ sour in taste and having unpleasant consequences for the teeth

= tree reaching up to 10 m. high, but usually pruned to around 5 m.; its leaves are grayish green above, and whitish underneath; its fruit is about 2 cm. long and a bit more than 1 cm. thick with a hard stone inside and a soft skin that covers the oily flesh; ► its fruit is used for food and oil for cooking, for lamps, for rubbing on the body, for medicine, and for anointing; ≈ regarded as beautiful and associated with well being
= flowers on a tree or bush
= a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose
= state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God
= state in which humans are unable to conceive a child

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= an object, usually of some value, given to a person; ► can be given without any expectation of exchange or often with the purpose to influence or persuade another person
= process by which someone becomes pregnant
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
literally: to establish; hence: = causative action by which deities and humans take all the steps that are needed for an event to take place
